titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

div.p: ~~It cannot but be injurious to the human mind never to be called into effort: the habit of receiving pleasure without any exertion of thought, by the mere excitement of curiosity & sensibility, may be justly ranked among the worst effects of habitual novel reading.~~
S. T. Coleridge. The Friend vol. I. p. 19

body.p: Convocation again all the morning: in the afternoon a discussion of the 'hardy annual' the Reform of Convocation was too much: I seceded from the sacred Synod, & had a walk with Logic in the Park.
